instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "Shuts Off" When Using Photoshop/AutoCAD
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> / 2010 has dual boot.
On bootcamp, screens turns off (laptop needs restarting) if we launch AutoCAD.
On OS X, it happens if we launch Photoshop.
I am assuming VGA.
Should I investigate anything or give it back?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "Shuts Off" When Using Photoshop/AutoCAD
threads.message: Replace <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> with a non tantalum. It won't fit properly, it will look like a midle finger.. but you'll make it work. :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> "Shuts Off" When Using Photoshop/AutoCAD
threads.message:
No Title

So far it's working. Thank you Louis!
I decided this was a cool way to solder it on.
